item.description: #englang #subject Unit 1 Transition Program Read about Helen Thompson’s [[The Eloquent Ape]] Find two [[Interesting English Language Articles]] and share them with the class Write a short 4 - 500 word essay on why “[[Freedom of Speech Essay|Freedom of speech gives people the right to use hate speech]]” Week 1: [[What is a Language?
#englang #essay Freedom of speech: it is an integral part of our society’s concept of freedom and liberty, and a right that many people do not have the privilege to exercise.
#englang #research The Scots Language This is a really interesting article I found through this video by xidnaf, and it talked about when a language actually becomes a different language.
#englang #article ![[The Eloquent Ape.pdf]] Language is like code, encoded in certain patterns of actions like vocal noises, which are then decoded to decypher meaning by someone else.

#englang #research Definition 1 Source: Language Meaning & Concept | What is Language? - Video & Lesson Transcript | Study.com Definition: Essentially, language is a term for any complex communication system used by humans that consists of words and phrases that, when combined, can create infinite variable utterances.

#lit #subject Unit 1 AoS 1: The Penelopiad Read an extract from [[A Thousand Ships Extract|A Thousand Ships]] and annotate, and then compare and contrast it with [[Calliope and the Painting|a painting]]

#lit #flashwrite Comment on the author’s use of tone and voice of the character Calliope in this extract. The author makes Calliope’s voice quite direct, using a lot of short clauses which comment on her own emotions and the state of the world around her.
#lit #flashwrite Both the painting and Calliope both look very tired, like this has been going on for so long and they just want it to end.
#physics #waves Did a prac with slinkies to explore longitudinal and transverse waves ![[Waves Worksheet.pdf]]

#physics #subject You can also view my [[Logbook]] which is a log of all practicals Unit 1 Week 1: Waves [[Wave Definitions]] for the parts of a wave [[WCCC 1]]: a weekly quiz handout to check our stage of learning

#physics #waves Î»: wavelength (m) Distance between two spots on a wave where it repeats Æ’: frequency (Hz) Cycles per second $Æ’ = \frac{1}{T}$ T: Period (s) Time taken for 1 cycle v: Velocity (m/s) $v=\frac{Î»}{T}$ $v=Æ’Î»$

#physics #wccc #waves Describe the motion of particles within a medium as a mechanical wave passes through the medium: The particles oscillate around a mean position, allowing for energy to be transferred through them without a net transfer of matter with zero displacement Which of the following statements are true and which are false?

item.title: School Subjects
item.description: [[English Language]] An analytical lens on the language of English as we know it and how it is used to communicate thoughts and ideas
